boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Third Edition)
boardgame.description: Blood Bowl is a game of Fantasy Football. The basic game features a match between a human team and an orc team. Ostensibly the teams are playing football. In fact each team takes turns moving, blocking and advancing the football down the field. The game comes with plastic miniatures._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This game is a part of the Blood Bowl Series_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Large-box 3rd edition. Main box corners worn. Orc team is assembled and 75% painted in red/white team colors. Human team is assembled and primed. Also has freebies: pewter goblin with chainsaw, pewter goblin with spiked chain, a snotling with a sign, and a converted Heroquest ogre. Shipping $12 for huge heavy box Will also trade! See my Want List and my Wish List for details. Buy multiple games to reduce shipping: I will estimtate shipping based on total package size. Send me a BGG message for any ask questions.

This is the 3rd edition. The box-top has a tear in two corners along with other wear and tear (Games Workshop didn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t make their boxes too well, did they:). The rules are missing (I have print out versions of the living rulebooks in-box). The scatter template is missing, but easily replaced by choosing a square to represent 1 on the scatter directions. One human lineman has been broken at the feet. Both pieces of the lineman are still in-box and could be repaired. The original retailer list and painting guide from when the game was printed (late 1980_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s or early _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;90s?) are inside. All miniatures are unpainted and unprimed. I will charge only actual shipping costs (Box, Materials, USPS priority mail w/delivery confirmation). The price is fairly negotiable, or I am willing to trade.

Blood Bowl (3rd Ed.) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Death Zone expansion w/ extras (Note: I will list this under both Blood Bowl and Death Zone. When I get an offer, I will cancel one of the two sales. Apologies if you are the second to respond and do not get the games.) This is a used copy of both items. Box condition is therefore “acceptable” at best, but components are in better condition than “acceptable” describes. I did not keep the Death Zone box: the board, books, cards, and such are in the Blood Bowl box, and the minis are in one homemade, foam-lined storage box and one plastic, foam-lined pistol case. Complete components from both games are present, with the exception of the decal sheets for the Orc and Human teams. Extras: * The Citadel Journal Blood Bowl Compendium (1998) * 4th Ed. Rules (unofficial print-outs – these may still be available elsewhere on the web, so if you don’t want to pay shipping for them, I’ll leave them out) * Above-average paint jobs (not ‘Eavy Metal, but neat, with some advanced techniques used) on the plastic minis and two of the four balls included in the Blood Bowl game. Bases flocked, number decals applied. (Humans in Altdorf blue, red, and yellow, Orcs in Black with Gold trim.) * 1 extra plastic Human Blitzer mini, painted, flocked and decaled to the same standard. * 2 metal Orc Blitzer minis, painted, flocked and decaled to the same standard. * 2 metal Orc Black Orc minis, painted, flocked and decaled to the same standard. * 1 metal Mighty Zug Human Star Player mini, primed and partially painted. * 3 metal Goblin minis, primed and partially painted. * 2 extra plastic Human Lineman minis and 1 extra Human Catcher mini, primed and partially painted. * 1 metal Cheerleader mini (either Human or Elf, suitable for Human team), primed but not painted. Optional extras at additional cost: * Human sideline team: 2 Imperial gun crew minis (primed but not painted) suitable for use as coach and assistant coach, a very nicely painted Imperial Celestial Wizard mini suitable for use as – you guessed it – a wizard and an Imperial Light Wizard suitable for use as an Apothecary. +$20 (based on the hours that went into making the Celestial Wizard so beautiful) * Dwarf Grudgebearers Team in box: 2 Troll Slayers, 2 Blitzers, 2 Runners, and 8 (2 extra) Long Beards. All but three of the Long Beards are badly painted (by someone else, I hasten to add), which IMO is worse than unpainted. Decals not present. Numbers marked on primed bases w/ pencil. +$25 * Wood Elf Athelorn Avengers Team in box: 2 Wardancers, 3 (1 extra) Catchers, 2 Throwers, 8 (2 extra) Linemen. Primed but unpainted, decal sheet present. +$30 * Skaven Skavenblight Scramblers Team in box: 3 (1 extra) Gutter Runners, 2 Throwers, 2 Storm Vermin, 8 (2 extra) Linemen, 1 (extra) Rat Ogre, 3 (extra) Mutants (Big Hand, Extra Arm, Claw). All primed but unpainted, decal sheet present. +$40 OR, take all the optional extras as a package for +$90. Please note that I will NOT try to shaft BGG out of their 3% on the payment for the optional extras. This just seemed like the best way to post a single-topic, multi-part lot.

This is the 1994 edition, in the double height box. This edition does not contain the living rule book but the original rules published in 1994. Game materials are otherwise all present and in very good condition. Box is in nice shape with a little shelf and edgewear. minis are painted UK only sale please

*Reserved for Tom* A long time ago, I purchased this game which was opened but unplayed and had a lot of extras added. I then purchased 4 professionally painted player groups from RAL Collectables. In 2006, I printed out the Blood Bowl Handbook (61 pages) and bound it. The only thing missing was an opponent. Even with 3 sons, 1 daughter and a game-playing husband, I could never find anybody who would play the game with me. I have finally given up and am selling the entire lot. I will describe it as clearly as possible. If you have questions, please email. It has been so long since I purchased everything that I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t remember the exact teams that I had RAL Collectables paint. In the game box (which has shelf wear, it was taped shut when it was shipped to me, but all corners are intact): - original handbook, mail order catalogue, unused team roster tablet, 4 footballs, 9 dice, 2 cardboard copies of the agility tables, how to paint your models, Blood Bowl magazine issues 1 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 2 with 4th Edition rules, Orc Team card, Human Team card, introduction on how to play, unpunched counters #1 thru #16, Griff Oberwald card, Nobbla Blackwart card, Scrappa Sorehead card, Morg _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;n_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; Thorg card, Death Zone cardboard chart (shows wear and has a 1/2 inch tear), unpunched sheet of markers, 2 tables with First Half - Second Half - Rerolls, etc, plastic football square with 1-8, plastic measurement for length of passes), unused stickers for Gouged Eye _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Reikland Reavers, unused game board, square plastic _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;sideline_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; - laminated team charts for Amazon, Chaos, Chaos Dwarf, High Elf, Halfling, Lizardman, Khemri, Dark Elf, Skaven, Orc, Human, Dwarf, Necromantic, Norse, Elf, Nurgle, Ogre, Vampire, Undead, Wood Elf, Goblin - 25 characters were in the box, some painted - 4 unpainted metal scantily clad women (not sure what they are) 3 of the 4 teams (or possibly partial teams, some have more miniatures than others) that I purchased and had painted were put in a hard plastic travel box with foam. You can see what the boxes look like if you look up RAL Collectables on youtube. He was out of boxes so one of the teams was put in a styrofoam-type container that he hollowed out to fit the pieces. In a black travel box, there are 17 undead miniatures. 16 are plastic - some look like skeletons and some look like zombie skeletons. One is a metal Frankenstein. This is my personal favorite team. In a blue travel box, 16 pieces are metal and 1 is plastic - the team has minotaurs and what look like golems? In a red travel box, there are 16 plastic pieces that I think are armoured humans. In the hollowed out styrofoam-like container are 12 painted plastic miniatures that I think are goblins - they have pointy helmets. The 3 hard plastic cases with foam inserts have room for more miniatures. I apologize for my general descriptions - I am no longer familiar with the game. But I will answer any questions and if somebody wants pictures just email me. My husband took pictures that I will eventually post on BGG. If you want the pictures and they are not posted yet, just send me your email address and I will send them to you.
